title: Why are two pure tones of identical frequency not heard as a doubling of that frequency? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: Why are two pure tones of identical frequency not heard as a doubling of that frequency? A: There has to be a non-linear or multiplying mechanism for frequency changing sound. Otherwise, you may notice regions of relative quiet and higher amplitude at the SAME frequency.
because sin(a) + sin(a) = 2*sin(a), which is a doubling of amplitude (loudness); and not sin(2*a), which would be a doubling of frequency (pitch)
